result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Antonio Sanabria Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
15A 038262

Had to add 5% restitution surcharge and re-apply bond.

Defendant Juan Antonio Sanabria in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Antonio Sanabria in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing, however, newly appointed counsel needs more time to review the case. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Antonio Sanabria in court with attorney Edgar Lin for attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received discovery and offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM033820  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-11-15
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mark M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Juan Antonio Sanabria in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-16-2015 at 01:30pm
